input_text:
Job Title: Operations Specialist/Officer

Location: Bennington, NE

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
i3 Bank is seeking an Operations Specialist/Officer to provide support for all areas of the bank and ensures banking questions and operations issues are resolved accurately and in a timely manner. Operations is acutely aware of all bank products and services and acts as a resource both internally and externally. Sound analytical and problem resolution skills are required to balance, review and process reports for DDA items, official checks, endorsement verifications, fraud to include check kiting, wire transfers, and return items. Title and pay will commensurate experience.
Essential Functions
Set up new customers for business online banking and assist with troubleshooting any issues in the system.Build new loans in Navigator, including personal, mortgage and commercial loans.Conduct maintenance on new accounts, loans, information changes, new cards, new commitments to include putting them on the system, printing and mailing notices of changes.Add new accounts and customer changes to system and reviews maintenance to verify information.Scan CIP, DDA, Savings and Cd’s in customer account on Director application.Provide support for Retail regarding banking questions, loans, accounts, duplicate and non-post items.Responsible for assisting in customer service calls regarding online banking, mobile banking, bill pay, business online banking, ACH file origination and mobile deposits.Execute wire transfers.Respond to inquiries in the bank’s “info” email inbox.Review ATM reports for non-processed transactions, ATM exceptions, and balance ATM Settlement account.Approve mobile deposits and check ACH file verifications daily.Write detailed procedures with screenshots for the Operations processes.Create Excel spreadsheets for balancing and for each customer in our BSA moderate risk assessment.Process ATM and Mastercard debit card orders, card capture requests and re-orders for expiring cards.Provide support for Operations Officers, coverage for Operations and completes special projects and services as assigned.
Provide backup and coverage for:Process and review all reports for ACH exceptions, returns, audits, transfers, check adjustments, large dollar return notifications, currency orders and any other requests as needed.Process all NSF, non-posted transactions and stop payment transactions daily and prepare notification to customers and all related entries as needed.Daily balancing of the official bank account (Fed and Cornerstone) and official checks identifying errors and making necessary reconciliations. Process daily tickets for incoming and outgoing returns, encoding, duplicate items and “due from account.”Perform daily entries and month end processing for MPF.


Job RequirementsThese specifications are general guidelines based on the minimum experience normally considered essential to the satisfactory performance of this position.Minimum of 3-5 years operations and/or banking experience required.Minimum 3-5 years of experience with banking software and an understanding of FiServ systems and particularly Business Process Manager preferred.Knowledge of banking operations, reconciliation and balancing and the ability to research when out of balance.Familiarity with CTR, SAR, OFAC, debits and credits, and multiple systems, software and apps.Strong time management and organizational skills including the ability to manage multiple projects and competing priorities.Excellent verbal and written communication skills; interpersonal and presentation skills – ability to work closely and collaboratively with people at all levels in the department and within the organization.Strong analytical thinker and detail oriented with the ability to proactively identify issues and assist in resolution.Excellent computer skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office Products (i.e. Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.).Knowledge of both the ACH Rules and Procedures as well as Debit Cards as it relates to returns, adjustments and rules.
Physical RequirementsThese are the physical demands, or representative of those, that must be met to perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Position requires sitting over 66% of the time.Position requires Visual Acuity at 20 inches (or less) over 66% of the time.Use of PC during the day - utilizing continuous viewing.Lift p to 25 pounds less than 10% of the time to carry coin bags or teller drawers.Ability to talk to communicate on phone and in person; read and interpret documents such as financial statements, regulatory, policy manuals and procedures.Reasoning ability to convey detailed instructions in writing and verbally; problem solving to handle multiple situations and issues in a calm manner.Ability to hear normal conversations and receive information and converse with others.Utilize a computer to perform daily duties and to prepare documents, using dexterity and hands for typing, physically moving and handling documents, etc.Ability to follow detailed and general instructions; basic math skills.Equal Employment Opportunity Policyi3 Bank provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.DEI StatementAt i3 Bank Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) drive value for our stakeholders and make us a stronger, smarter and more informed organization. We are passionate about attracting and retaining talent with the mix of skills and expertise needed to maximize our effectiveness. We are committed to an open and inclusive environment. We cultivate a supportive, equitable and welcoming hiring process and ensure the growth and development of our employees so we can provide the best products and services to our clients and the communities we serve.

Experience Level (if available): None
